channel.title: Jdk and Jre...wtf?
channel.description:
I feel horrible for asking this but I recently got a new computer, and all the jdk and jre stuff I set for the servers are lost, and now I can't get them to work!
First off, I know for a FACT I have jdk 6 update 14, and jre update 14. My compiler (named build, but I think its a compiler) for my client I'm trying to open says "Cannot find the path specified."
This is what the compiler looks like (notepad): [code]@echo off Title (Name) Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe" ./files/*.java pause[/code]
In Environment Variables, this is my Path and Classpath:
Classpath: (is there a ";" missing after the 2nd bin?) [code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin[/code]
Path: [code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;[/code]
lastly, when I open the folder "Java" in program files, a file called jre6 is there. I don't know if that should be there, but you tell me. Thanks to anyone that helps.. Again I apologize for this question as I know it's been posted several times, but I've searched and searched and tried several things and nothing is working.

item.title: Jdk and Jre...wtf?
item.dc:creator: @_BBLLAARRGGHH __--BBLLAARRGGHH--__
item.description:
@_BBLLAARRGGHH wrote:

Can you download a source with a basic layout and see if that works? I think it can’t find the things to compile. the ./files/*.java

item.title: Jdk and Jre...wtf?
item.dc:creator: @cheese8 cheese8
item.description:
@cheese8 wrote:

I feel horrible for asking this but I recently got a new computer, and all the jdk and jre stuff I set for the servers are lost, and now I can’t get them to work!

First off, I know for a FACT I have jdk 6 update 14, and jre update 14. My compiler (named build, but I think its a compiler) for my client I’m trying to open says “Cannot find the path specified.”

This is what the compiler looks like (notepad):

@echo off Title (Name) Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe" ./files/*.java pause

In Environment Variables, this is my Path and Classpath:

Classpath: (is there a “;” missing after the 2nd bin?)

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin

Path:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin;

lastly, when I open the folder “Java” in program files, a file called jre6 is there. I don’t know if that should be there, but you tell me. Thanks to anyone that helps… Again I apologize for this question as I know it’s been posted several times, but I’ve searched and searched and tried several things and nothing is working.
